intro: Bidens tripartita f. infirma, commonly known as the dwarf ironweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and streambanks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
